heading: Innateness hypothesis (Linguistics).
general-note: Here are entered works on the psycholinguistic theory that a child is born with innate or biogenetic knowledge of certain universal structural principles of human language which are central to the process of language acquisition. Works on the linguistic theories based on ReneÃÅ Descartes and French grammarians of Port Royal, positing that human language rests on a thought structure common to all mankind, are entered under the heading. Cartesian linguistics..
